member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.ExpressionBase.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IDoubleDispatcher. The dispatch method does not invoke Dispatch on any child objects. If child traversal is desired, the implementations of the Visit methods should do the subsequent dispatching.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.MetadataObject
member.summary: Represents a metadata entity. This has an associated Token Value... This is used in maintaining type spec cache.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.MetadataDefinitionObject
member.summary: Base class of Namespaces/Types/TypeMembers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.MetadataObjectDocument.Location
member.summary: The location where this document was found, or where it should be stored. This will also uniquely identify the source document within an instance of compilation host.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.MetadataObjectDocument.Name
member.summary: The name of the document. For example the name of the file if the document corresponds to a file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.MetadataLocation.Definition
member.summary: The metadata object whose definition contains this location.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.MetadataLocation.Document
member.summary: The document containing this location.

member.summary: Contains generic implementation of being a container as well as a scope.

The type of objects as they are exposed outside

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.Namespace.RootOwner
member.summary: The object associated with the namespace. For example an IUnit or IUnitSet instance. This namespace is either the root namespace of that object or it is a nested namespace that is directly of indirectly nested in the root namespace.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.GenericMethodInstanceReferenceWithToken.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodReference,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference},Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory,System.UInt32)
member.param: The most significant byte identifies a metadata table, using the values specified by ECMA-335. The least significant three bytes represent the row number in the table, with the first row being numbered as one. If, for some implemenation reason, a metadata object implements this interface but was not obtained from a metadata table (for example it might be an array type reference that only occurs in a signature blob), the the value is UInt32.MaxValue.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.GenericMethodInstanceReferenceWithToken.TokenValue
member.summary: The most significant byte identifies a metadata table, using the values specified by ECMA-335. The least significant three bytes represent the row number in the table, with the first row being numbered as one. If, for some implemenation reason, a metadata object implements this interface but was not obtained from a metadata table (for example it might be an array type reference that only occurs in a signature blob), the the value is UInt32.MaxValue.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderException
member.summary: Generic exception thrown by the internal implementation. This exception is not meant to be leaked outside, hence all the public classes where this exception can be thrown needs to catch this.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataReaderErrorsReporter
member.summary: This interface is implemented by providers of Module read write errors. That is, errors discovered while reading the metadata/il. Many of these errors will be discovered incrementally and as part of background activities.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReaderErrorsReporter
member.summary: Dummy class to identify the error reporter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader
member.summary: Factory for loading assemblies and modules persisted as portable executable (pe) files.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataReaderHost)
member.summary: Allocates a factory for loading assemblies and modules persisted as portable executable (pe) files.
member.param: The host is used for providing access to pe files (OpenBinaryDocument), applying host specific unification policies (UnifyAssembly, UnifyAssemblyReference, UnifyModuleReference) and for deciding whether and how to load referenced assemblies and modules (ResolvingAssemblyReference, ResolvingModuleReference).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.RegisterCoreAssembly(Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.Assembly)
member.summary: Registers the core assembly. This is called by PEFileToObjectModel when it recognizes that assembly being loaded is the Core assembly as identified by the Compilation Host.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.OpenMemberModules(Microsoft.Cci.IBinaryDocument,Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.Assembly)
member.summary: This method is called when an assembly is loaded. This makes sure that all the member modules of the assembly are loaded.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.OpenAssembly(Microsoft.Cci.IBinaryDocument,Microsoft.Cci.AssemblyIdentity@)
member.summary: Method to open the assembly in MetadataReader. This method loads the assembly and returns the object corresponding to the opened assembly. Also returns the AssemblyIdentifier corresponding to the assembly as the out parameter. Only assemblies that unify to themselves can be opened i.e. if the unification policy of the compilation host says that mscorlib 1.0 unifies to mscorlib 2.0 then only mscorlib 2.0 can be loaded.
member.param: The binary document that needes to be opened as an assembly.
Contains the assembly identifier of the binary document in case it is an assembly.
member.returns: Assembly that is loaded or Dummy.Assembly in case assembly could not be loaded.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.OpenModule(Microsoft.Cci.IBinaryDocument,Microsoft.Cci.ModuleIdentity@)
member.summary: Method to open the module in the MetadataReader. This method loads the module and returns the object corresponding to the opened module. Also returns the ModuleIDentifier corresponding to the module as the out parameter. Modules are opened as if they are not contained in any assembly.
member.param: The binary document that needes to be opened as an module.
Contains the module identity of the binary document in case it is an module.
member.returns: Module that is loaded or Dummy.Module in case module could not be loaded.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.OpenAssembly(Microsoft.Cci.IBinaryDocument)
member.summary: Method to open the assembly in MetadataReader. This method loads the assembly and returns the object corresponding to the opened assembly. Also returns the AssemblyIdentifier corresponding to the assembly as the out parameter. Only assemblies that unify to themselves can be opened i.e. if the unification policy of the compilation host says that mscorlib 1.0 unifies to mscorlib 2.0 then only mscorlib 2.0 can be loaded.
member.param: The binary document that needes to be opened as an assembly.
member.returns: Assembly that is loaded or Dummy.Assembly in case assembly could not be loaded.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.OpenModule(Microsoft.Cci.IBinaryDocument)
member.summary: Method to open the module in the MetadataReader. This method loads the module and returns the object corresponding to the opened module. Also returns the ModuleIDentifier corresponding to the module as the out parameter. Modules are opened as if they are not contained in any assembly.
member.param: The binary document that needes to be opened as an module.
member.returns: Module that is loaded or Dummy.Module in case module could not be loaded.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.LookupAssembly(Microsoft.Cci.IModule,Microsoft.Cci.AssemblyIdentity)
member.summary: Does a look up in the loaded assemblies if the given assembly identified by assemblyIdentifier is loaded. This also gives a chance to MetadataReaderHost to delay load the assembly if needed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.LookupModule(Microsoft.Cci.IModule,Microsoft.Cci.ModuleIdentity)
member.summary: Does a look up in the loaded modules if the given module identified by moduleIdentifier is loaded. This also gives a chance to MetadataReaderHost to delay load the module if needed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.GetAssemblyIdentifier(Microsoft.Cci.IBinaryDocument)
member.summary: If the given binary document contains a CLR assembly, return the identity of the assembly. Otherwise, return null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.GetAssemblyIdentifier(Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.PEFile.PEFileReader)
member.summary: Computes the AssemblyIdentifier of the PE File. This requires that peFile is an assembly.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.GetModuleIdentifier(Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.PEFile.PEFileReader)
member.summary: Computes the ModuleIdentifier of the PE File as if the module did not belong to any assembly.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.GetModuleIdentifier(Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.PEFile.PEFileReader,Microsoft.Cci.AssemblyIdentity)
member.summary: Computes the ModuleIdentifier of the PE File as if the module belong to given assembly.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.FindModule(Microsoft.Cci.ModuleIdentity)
member.summary: Returns the module corresponding to passed moduleIdentifier if it was loaded.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.FindAssembly(Microsoft.Cci.AssemblyIdentity)
member.summary: Returns the assembly corresponding to passed assemblyIdentifier if it was loaded.
member.param: THe assembly Identifier that is unified with respect to the compilation host.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.ResolveSerializedTypeName(System.String,Microsoft.Cci.IAssembly)
member.summary: Resolves the serialized type name as if it belonged to the passed assembly.
member.param: Serialized type name.
Assembly in which this needs to be resolved. If null then it is to be resolved in mscorlib.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.OpenedModules
member.summary: Lists all the opened modules.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.DefaultHost
member.summary: A simple host environment using default settings inherited from MetadataReaderHost and that uses PeReader as its metadata reader.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.DefaultHost.#ctor
member.summary: Allocates a simple host environment using default settings inherited from MetadataReaderHost and that uses PeReader as its metadata reader.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.DefaultHost.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.INameTable)
member.summary: Allocates a simple host environment using default settings inherited from MetadataReaderHost and that uses PeReader as its metadata reader.
member.param: A collection of IName instances that represent names that are commonly used during compilation. This is a provided as a parameter to the host environment in order to allow more than one host environment to co-exist while agreeing on how to map strings to IName instances.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.PeReader.DefaultHost.LoadUnitFrom(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the unit that is stored at the given location, or a dummy unit if no unit exists at that location or if the unit at that location is not accessible.
member.param: A path to the file that contains the unit of metdata to load.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.CoreTypes
member.summary: These types are used to implement properties such as ITypeDefinition.IsEnum, which relies on checking that the base type is a well known type form the core assembly (mscorlib, for example). This module may refer to these types via a reference assembly which forwards type references to the real core assembly. Since we should not resolve any type references, and since the host's platform types may be referencing the real core assembly, we need to set up references to types from this module's idea of the core assembly.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.MetadataReaderTypeKind
member.summary: Enumeration to identify various type kinds

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.MetadataReaderSignatureTypeCode
member.summary: A enumeration of all of the types that can be used in IL operations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.IMetadataReaderNamedTypeReference
member.summary: This represents either a namespace or nested type. This supports fast comparision of nominal types using interned module id, namespace name, type name and parent type reference in case of nested type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.IMetadataReaderNamedTypeReference.TryResolveAsExportedType
member.summary: Type references resolve to type definitions. The resolution process traverses zero or more entries in exported type tables, also known as type aliases. If a reference is indirected via a type alias, ITypeReference.IsAlias is true and ITypeReference.AliasForType exposes the information in the relevant row of the exported type table. This method returns an object with that information, if available. If not available, it returns null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.CoreTypeReference
member.summary: Represents the core types such as int, float, object etc from the core assembly. These are created if these types are not directly referenced by the assembly being loaded.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.TypeRefReference
member.summary: Represents type reference to types in TypeRef table. This could either be Namespace type reference or nested type reference.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.TypeRefReference.TryResolveAsExportedType
member.summary: Type references resolve to type definitions. The resolution process traverses zero or more entries in exported type tables, also known as type aliases. If a reference is indirected via a type alias, ITypeReference.IsAlias is true and ITypeReference.AliasForType exposes the information in the relevant row of the exported type table. This method returns an object with that information, if available. If not available, it returns null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.NamespaceTypeRefReference.TryResolveAsExportedType
member.summary: Type references resolve to type definitions. The resolution process traverses zero or more entries in exported type tables, also known as type aliases. If a reference is indirected via a type alias, ITypeReference.IsAlias is true and ITypeReference.AliasForType exposes the information in the relevant row of the exported type table. This method returns an object with that information, if available. If not available, it returns null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.TypeCache.LeastUpperBound(Microsoft.Cci.TypeMemberVisibility,Microsoft.Cci.TypeMemberVisibility)
member.summary: Least upper bound of the Type member visibility considered as the following lattice: Public FamilyOrAssembly Family Assembly FamilyAndAssembly Private Other

member.summary: Returns -1 if the first byte is 0xFF. This is used to represent the index for the null string.

member.summary: Given a parent type and mangled type name of the nested type, this method resolves it.

member.summary: Given a namespace full name and type's mangled name this method resolves it to a type alias, if such an alias exists in this module.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.PEFileToObjectModel.ResolveExportedNestedType(Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.ExportedTypeAliasBase,Microsoft.Cci.IName)
member.summary: Given a alias type and type's mangled name this method resolves it to a nested aliased type. Aliased type can further be walked to find the exact type it resolved to.

member.summary: Cache for type ref's in the module.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.PEFileToObjectModel.ResolveModuleTypeRefReference(Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.IMetadataReaderNamedTypeReference)
member.summary: This method resolves TypeRef as a non exported type. i.e. the said type reference refers to the type in the type def table direcly rather than exported type table of the assembly.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.PEFileToObjectModel.TryToResolveNamespaceTypeReferenceAsExportedType(Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.NamespaceTypeRefReference)
member.summary: This method tries to resolves the give namespace type reference as an exported type.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.PEFileToObjectModel.GetReferenceToAliasedType(Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.ObjectModelImplementation.ExportedTypeAliasBase)
member.summary: Returns a reference to the type that the given alias stands for. For example, if alias is a type forwarder, return a reference to the forwarded type (in another assembly).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.DefaultWindowsRuntimeHost
member.summary: A simple host environment using default settings inherited from WindowsRuntimeMetadataReaderHost and that uses PeReader as its metadata reader.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.WindowsRuntimeMetadataReaderHost
member.summary: A base class for an object provided by the application hosting the metadata reader. The object allows the host application to control how assembly references are unified, where files are found, how Windows Runtime types and methods are projected to CLR types and methods and so on. The object also controls the lifetime of things such as memory mapped files and blocks of unmanaged memory. Be sure to call Dispose on the object when it is no longer needed and the associated locks and/or memory must be released immediately.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.WindowsRuntimeMetadataReaderHost.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.INameTable,Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory,System.Byte,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: A base class for an object provided by the application hosting the metadata reader. The object allows the host application to control how assembly references are unified, where files are found, how Windows Runtime types and methods are projected to CLR types and methods and so on. The object also controls the lifetime of things such as memory mapped files and blocks of unmanaged memory. Be sure to call Dispose on the object when it is no longer needed and the associated locks and/or memory must be released immediately.
member.param: A collection of IName instances that represent names that are commonly used during compilation. This is a provided as a parameter to the host environment in order to allow more than one host environment to co-exist while agreeing on how to map strings to IName instances.
The intern factory to use when generating keys. When comparing two or more assemblies using TypeHelper, MemberHelper, etc. it is necessary to make the hosts use the same intern factory.

The size of a pointer on the runtime that is the target of the metadata units to be loaded into this metadta host. This parameter only matters if the host application wants to work out what the exact layout of a struct will be on the target runtime. The framework uses this value in methods such as TypeHelper.SizeOfType and TypeHelper.TypeAlignment. If the host application does not care about the pointer size it can provide 0 as the value of this parameter. In that case, the first reference to IMetadataHost.PointerSize will probe the list of loaded assemblies to find an assembly that either requires 32 bit pointers or 64 bit pointers. If no such assembly is found, the default is 32 bit pointers.
A collection of strings that are interpreted as valid paths which are used to search for units.
Whether the GAC (Global Assembly Cache) should be searched when resolving references.
True if the host should project references to certain Windows Runtime types and methods to corresponding CLR types and methods, in order to emulate the runtime behavior of the CLR.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.WindowsRuntimeMetadataReaderHost.GetPlatformType
member.summary: Returns an object that provides a collection of references to types from the core platform, such as System.Object and System.String.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.WindowsRuntimeMetadataReaderHost.Rewrite(Microsoft.Cci.IUnit,Microsoft.Cci.IMethodDefinition)
member.summary: Provides the host with an opportunity to substitute one method definition for another during metadata reading. This avoids the cost of rewriting the entire unit in order to make such changes.
member.param: The unit that is defines the method.
A method definition encountered during metadata reading.
member.returns: Usually the value in methodDefinition, but occassionally something else.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.WindowsRuntimeMetadataReaderHost.Redirect(Microsoft.Cci.IUnit,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Microsoft.Cci.IAssemblyReference})
member.summary: Provides the host with an opportunity to add, remove or substitute assembly references in the given list. This avoids the cost of rewriting the entire unit in order to make such changes.
member.param: The unit that contains these references.
The assembly references to substitute.
member.returns: Usually assemblyReferences, but occasionally a modified enumeration.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.WindowsRuntimeMetadataReaderHost.Redirect(Microsoft.Cci.IUnit,Microsoft.Cci.INamedTypeReference)
member.summary: Provides the host with an opportunity to substitute one type reference for another during metadata reading. This avoids the cost of rewriting the entire unit in order to make such changes.
member.param: The unit that contains the reference.
A type reference encountered during metadata reading.
member.returns: Usually the value in typeReference, but occassionally something else.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.WindowsRuntimeMetadataReaderHost.Rewrite(Microsoft.Cci.IUnit,Microsoft.Cci.ICustomAttribute)
member.summary: Provides the host with an opportunity to substitute a custom attribute with another during metadata reading. This avoids the cost of rewriting the entire unit in order to make such changes.
member.param: The unit that contains the custom attribute.
The custom attribute to rewrite (fix up).
member.returns: Usually the value in customAttribute, but occassionally another custom attribute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.WindowsRuntimeMetadataReaderHost.UnifyAssembly(Microsoft.Cci.AssemblyIdentity)
member.summary: Default implementation of UnifyAssembly. Override this method to change the behavior.

member.param: True if the host should project references to certain Windows Runtime types and methods to corresponding CLR types and methods, in order to emulate the runtime behavior of the CLR.

member.param: A collection of IName instances that represent names that are commonly used during compilation. This is a provided as a parameter to the host environment in order to allow more than one host environment to co-exist while agreeing on how to map strings to IName instances.
True if the host should project references to certain Windows Runtime types and methods to corresponding CLR types and methods, in order to emulate the runtime behavior of the CLR.

member.summary: Returns an identity that is the same as CoreAssemblyIdentity, except that the name is "System.Runtime.WindowsRuntime.UI.Xaml" and the version is at least 4.0.
